Detailed Description

The CFAR detection algorithm based on floating point input signal.

Function Documentation

uint32_t mmwavelib_cfarfloat_caall ( float32_t *  InputPower,
uint32_t  fftSize,
uint8_t  cfarType,
uint32_t  guardLen,
uint32_t  searchLen,
uint32_t  leftSkipLen,
uint32_t  rightSkipLen,
float32_t  relThr,
uint32_t *  index,
float32_t *  noise 
)

Function Name : mmwavelib_cfarfloat_caall.

Description : Performs a regular Cell Averaging (CFAR-CA), Cell Accumulation (CFAR-CACC), Cell SO (CFAR-SO), and Cell GO CFAR (CFAR-GO) based on floating point signal power. The first CUT index is leftSkipLen. and its left noise samples are the samples from leftSkipLen+guardLen to leftSkipLen+guardLen+guardLen+searchLen- 1. The last CUT index is fftSize-leftSkipLen, and its right noise samples are the samples from fftSize-rightSkipLen-guardLen-searchLen-rightSkipLen to fftSize-rightSkipLen-rightSkipLen -1.
Parameters
[in]InputPower: input signal power array (floating point)
[in]fftSize: number of elements in the InputPower
[in]cfarType: 0-CFAR-CA, 1-CFAR-CAGO, 2-CFAR-SO, 3-CFAR-CACC
[in]guardLen: one sided guard length
[in]searchLen: one sided search length
[in]leftSkipLen: number of samiples to be skipped on the left side in the search array
[in]rightSkipLen: number of samiples to be skipped on the right side in the search array
[in]relThr: the relative threshold between noise power and signal power. if signal power is greater then relThr*noisepower, declare a peak
[out]index: output array with indices of the detected peaks
[out]noise: output array with the noise power for every detected peaks, it is the noise power used in the CFAR detection. If it is the CFAR-CA, the noise power is the average power for all the samples in the two-sides search window. if it is CFAR-CACC, the noise power is the sum of the powers for the samples in the two sides search window, if it is CFAR-SO, it is the minimum average power between samples in the two sides search window, if it is CFAR-GO, it is the maximum average power between samples in the two sides search window.
Returns
Number of detected peaks (i.e length of out)
Precondition

cycles 8.40*fftsize + 677 (cgt 8.1.3)

uint32_t mmwavelib_cfarfloat_caall_opt ( float32_t *  InputPower,
uint32_t  fftSize,
uint8_t  cfarType,
uint32_t  guardLen,
uint32_t  searchLen,
uint32_t  leftSkipLen,
uint32_t  rightSkipLen,
float32_t  relThr,
uint32_t *  index,
float32_t *  noise 
)

Function Name : mmwavelib_cfarfloat_caall_opt.

Description : Performs a regular Cell Averaging, Cell Accumulation, SO, and GO CFAR based on floating point signal power same as function mmwavelib_cfarfloat_caall, but with less cycles, and the detected peaks are not in ascending order.
Parameters
[in]InputPower: input signal power array (floating point)
[in]fftSize: number of elements in the InputPower
[in]cfarType: 0-CFAR-CA, 1-CFAR-GO, 2-CFAR-SO, 3-CFAR-CACC
[in]guardLen: one sided guard length
[in]searchLen: one sided search length
[in]leftSkipLen: number of samiples to be skipped on the left side in the search array
[in]rightSkipLen: number of samiples to be skipped on the right side in the search array
[in]relThr: the relative threshold between noise power and signal power. if signal power is greater then relThr*noisepower, declare a peak
[out]index: output array with indices of the detected peaks
[out]noise: output array with the noise power for every detected peaks, it is the noise power used in the CFAR detection. If it is the CFAR-CA, the noise power is the average power for all the samples in the two-sides search window. if it is CFAR-CACC, the noise power is the sum of the powers for the samples in the two sides search window, if it is CFAR-SO, it is the minimum average power between samples in the two sides search window, if it is CFAR-GO, it is the maximum average power between samples in the two sides search window.
Returns
Number of detected peaks (i.e length of out)
Precondition

cycles 4.49*fftsize+981 (cgt 8.1.3)

uint8_t mmwavelib_cfarfloat_point ( float32_t *  InputPower,
uint32_t  fftSize,
uint8_t  cfarType,
uint32_t  guardLen,
uint32_t  searchLen,
float32_t  relThr,
uint32_t  index,
float32_t *  noise 
)

Function Name : mmwavelib_cfarfloat_point.

Description : Performs single CUT CFAR detection using Cell Averaging, Cell Accumulation, Cell SO, or Cell GO CFAR based on floating point signal power.
Parameters
[in]InputPower: input signal power array (floating point)
[in]fftSize: number of elements in the InputPower
[in]cfarType: 0-CFAR-CA, 1-CFAR-GO, 2-CFAR-SO, 3-CFAR-CACC
[in]guardLen: one sided guard length
[in]searchLen: one sided search length
[in]relThr: the relative threshold between noise power and signal power. if signal power is greater then relThr*noisepower, declare a peak
[in]index: the detected element index in the InputPower array
[out]noise: output noise power for the detected index
Returns
1 if it is a peak, 0 if not a peak
Precondition

cycles 540 (cgt 8.1.3)

uint32_t mmwavelib_cfarfloat_wrap ( float32_t *  InputPower,
uint32_t  fftSize,
uint8_t  cfarType,
uint32_t  guardLen,
uint32_t  searchLen,
float32_t  relThr,
uint32_t *  index,
float32_t *  noise 
)

Function Name : mmwavelib_cfarfloat_wrap.

Description : Performs a regular Cell Averaging, Cell Accumulation, Cell SO, and Cell GO CFAR based on floating point signal power. The noise samples for the cell at the edges are the wrap around samples.
Parameters
[in]InputPower: input signal power array (floating point)
[in]fftSize: number of elements in the InputPower
[in]cfarType: 0-CFAR-CA, 1-CFAR-GO, 2-CFAR-SO, 3-CFAR-CACC
[in]guardLen: one sided guard length
[in]searchLen: one sided search length
[in]relThr: the relative threshold between noise power and signal power. if signal power is greater then relThr*noisepower, declare a peak
[out]index: output array with indices of the detected peaks
[out]noise: output array with the noise power for every detected peaks, it is the noise power used in the CFAR detection. If it is the CFAR-CA, the noise power is the average power for all the samples in the two-sides search window. if it is CFAR-CACC, the noise power is the sum of the powers for the samples in the two sides search window, if it is CFAR-SO, it is the minimum average power between samples in the two sides search window, if it is CFAR-GO, it is the maximum average power between samples in the two sides search window.
Returns
Number of detected peaks (i.e length of out)
Precondition

cycles 8.02*fftSize + 604 (cgt 8.1.3)

uint32_t mmwavelib_cfarfloat_wrap_opt ( float32_t *  InputPower,
uint32_t  fftSize,
uint8_t  cfarType,
uint32_t  guardLen,
uint32_t  searchLen,
float32_t  relThr,
uint32_t *  index,
float32_t *  noise 
)

Function Name : mmwavelib_cfarfloat_wrap_opt.

Description : Performs a regular Cell Averaging, Cell Accumulation, Cell SO, and Cell GO CFAR based on floating point signal power, same as mmwavelib_cfarfloat_wrap, but with less cycles, and the detected peaks are not in ascending order.
Parameters
[in]InputPower: input signal power array (floating point)
[in]fftSize: number of elements in the InputPower
[in]cfarType: 0-CFAR-CA, 1-CFAR-GO, 2-CFAR-SO, 3-CFAR-CACC
[in]guardLen: one sided guard length
[in]searchLen: one sided search length
[in]relThr: the relative threshold between noise power and signal power. if signal power is greater then relThr*noisepower, declare a peak
[out]index: output array with indices of the detected peaks
[out]noise: output array with the noise power for every detected peaks, it is the noise power used in the CFAR detection. If it is the CFAR-CA, the noise power is the average power for all the samples in the two-sides search window. if it is CFAR-CACC, the noise power is the sum of the powers for the samples in the two sides search window, if it is CFAR-SO, it is the minimum average power between samples in the two sides search window, if it is CFAR-GO, it is the maximum average power between samples in the two sides search window.
Returns
Number of detected peaks (i.e length of out)
Precondition

cycles 4.5*fftSize + 894 (cgt 8.1.3)
